result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Earl Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Earl Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for James Earl Johnson.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 and COUNT 2: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.

Defendant James Earl Johnson in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Defendant James Earl Johnson in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense counsel received an offer from the State and requested a Plea hearing date. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Plea hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 9:30 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant James Earl Johnson in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Defendant James Earl Johnson in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense has received Discovery material, but has not received an Offer Letter. Parties negotiating and advised the Court of possible resolution. Defense requested additional time to review case. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Scheduling Conference scheduled July 22 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held Via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant James Earl Johnson in court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

HELD OFF THE RECORD VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE. 
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant advised the court that Attorney Christopher Carson is would not be appearing not available for todays hearing. Court ordered Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Scheduling Conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant James Earl Johnson in court, appear by video in custody with attorney Christopher Scott Carson, appear in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judical Notice to case 11CF544. Sworn for the State: MPD Dectective M. Driscoll. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 047047,
Payable Number: 1007048,
Receipt Number: 22RP019881,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant James Earl Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KA, dob 10/9/1996, TLJ, dob 1/22/1998, KDA, dob 5/8/1995, and IR, dob 2/7/2004.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Earl Johnson in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant James Earl Johnson in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Earl Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
